00017 /**
00018  *      save a page in the cache
00019  *
00020  *      @param string $category cache category (e.g. 'page')
00021  *      @param string $name item name
00022  *      @param string $out content
00023  *      @return true if successful, false if not
00024  */
00025 function cache_output($category, $name, $out)
00026 {
00027         // don't cache the output if we're using https
00028         if (!empty($_SERVER['HTTPS'])) {
00029                 log_msg('debug', 'common: not caching '.quot($name).' because of https');
00030                 return false;
00031         }
00032         
00033         // check if cache dir exists
00034         $f = CONTENT_DIR.'/cache';
00035         if (!is_dir($f)) {
00036                 $m = umask(0000);
00037                 if (!@mkdir($f, 0777)) {
00038                         umask($m);
00039                         log_msg('error', 'common: cannot create cache directory '.quot($f));
00040                         return false;
00041                 }
00042                 umask($m);
00043         }
00044         
00045         // check if category subdirectory exists
00046         $f .= '/'.$category;
00047         if (!is_dir($f)) {
00048                 $m = umask(0000);
00049                 if (!@mkdir($f, 0777)) {
00050                         umask($m);
00051                         log_msg('error', 'common: cannot create cache directory '.quot($f));
00052                         return false;
00053                 }
00054                 umask($m);
00055         }
00056         
00057         // save file
00058         $f .= '/'.$name;
00059         $m = umask(0111);
00060         if (!file_put_contents($f, $out)) {
00061                 umask($m);
00062                 log_msg('error', 'common: error writing cache file '.quot($f));
00063                 return false;
00064         }
00065         umask($m);
00066         
00067         log_msg('debug', 'common: cached '.$category.' '.quot($name));
00068         return true;
00069 }

00119 /**
00120  *      remove a page from the cache
00121  *
00122  *      If no name is given, all pages of the category are being removed.
00123  *      @param string $category cache category (e.g. 'page')
00124  *      @param string $name item name (optional)
00125  */
00126 function drop_cache($category, $name = '')
00127 {
00128         if (empty($name)) {
00129                 $d = @scandir(CONTENT_DIR.'/cache/'.$category);
00130                 if ($d === false) {
00131                         return;
00132                 }
00133         } else {
00134                 $d = array($name);
00135         }
00136         
00137         foreach ($d as $f) {
00138                 if ($f == '.' || $f == '..') {
00139                         continue;
00140                 }
00141                 $fn = CONTENT_DIR.'/cache/'.$category.'/'.$f;
00142                 if (@unlink($fn)) {
00143                         log_msg('debug', 'common: dropped cache of '.$category.' '.quot($f));
00144                 }
00145         }
00146 }

00165 /**
00166  *      invoke a hook when an update was detected
00167  */
00168 function handle_updates()
00169 {
00170         $new = glue_version();
00171         $write_file = false;
00172         
00173         if (($s = @file_get_contents(CONTENT_DIR.'/version')) !== false) {
00174                 // parse version
00175                 $a = expl('.', $s);
00176                 $old = array(0, 0, 0);
00177                 for ($i=0; $i < count($a); $i++) {
00178                         $old[$i] = $a[$i];
00179                 }
00180                 // check if an update happened
00181                 if ($old != $new) {
00182                         log_msg('info', 'common: detected hotglue update from version '.implode('.', $old).' to '.implode('.', $new));
00183                         // hook
00184                         invoke_hook('glue_update', array('old'=>$old, 'new'=>$new));
00185                         $write_file = true;
00186                 }
00187         } else {
00188                 $write_file = true;
00189         }
00190         
00191         if ($write_file) {
00192                 $m = umask(0111);
00193                 @file_put_contents(CONTENT_DIR.'/version', implode('.', $new));
00194                 umask($m);
00195         }
00196 }

00271 /**
00272  *      check if the user is authenticated or not
00273  *
00274  *      @return true if authenticated, false if not
00275  */
00276 function is_auth()
00277 {
00278         if (AUTH_METHOD == 'none') {
00279                 log_msg('debug', 'common: auth success (auth_method none)');
00280                 return true;
00281         } elseif (AUTH_METHOD == 'basic') {
00282                 if (isset($_SERVER['PHP_AUTH_USER']) && isset($_SERVER['PHP_AUTH_PW'])) {
00283                         if ($_SERVER['PHP_AUTH_USER'] == AUTH_USER && $_SERVER['PHP_AUTH_PW'] == AUTH_PASSWORD) {
00284                                 log_msg('debug', 'common: auth success (auth_method basic)');
00285                                 return true;
00286                         } else {
00287                                 log_msg('info', 'common: auth failure (auth_method basic)');
00288                                 return false;
00289                         }
00290                 } else {
00291                         if (!empty($_SERVER['HTTP_AUTHORIZATION'])) {
00292                                 log_msg('warn', 'common: no auth data (auth_method basic) but HTTP_AUTHORIZATION is '.quot(var_dump_inl($_SERVER['HTTP_AUTHORIZATION'])));
00293                         } else {
00294                                 log_msg('debug', 'common: no auth data (auth_method basic)');
00295                         }
00296                         return false;
00297                 }
00298         } elseif (AUTH_METHOD == 'digest') {
00299                 if (isset($_SERVER['PHP_AUTH_DIGEST'])) {
00300                         log_msg('debug', 'common: auth digest '.var_dump_inl($_SERVER['PHP_AUTH_DIGEST']));
00301                         $res = http_digest_check(array(AUTH_USER=>AUTH_PASSWORD), SITE_NAME);
00302                         if ($res == 0) {
00303                                 log_msg('debug', 'common: auth success (auth_method digest)');
00304                                 return true;
00305                         } else {
00306                                 log_msg('info', 'common: auth failure '.$res.' (auth_method digest)');
00307                                 return false;
00308                         }
00309                 } else {
00310                         if (!empty($_SERVER['HTTP_AUTHORIZATION'])) {
00311                                 log_msg('warn', 'common: no auth data (auth_method digest) but HTTP_AUTHORIZATION is '.quot(var_dump_inl($_SERVER['HTTP_AUTHORIZATION'])));
00312                         } else {
00313                                 log_msg('debug', 'common: no auth data (auth_method digest)');
00314                         }
00315                         return false;
00316                 }
00317         } else {
00318                 log_msg('error', 'common: invalid or missing AUTH_METHOD config setting');
00319                 return false;
00320         }
00321 }

00324 /**
00325  *      check if a page can be served from the cache
00326  *
00327  *      @param string $category cache category (e.g. 'page')
00328  *      @param string $name item name
00329  *      @param int $max_age serve from cache when younger than $max_age seconds
00330  *      @return bool true if the page can be served from cache, false if not
00331  */
00332 function is_cached($category, $name, $max_age)
00333 {
00334         // don't use the cached file if we're using https
00335         // TODO (later): make a separate cache for https
00336         if (!empty($_SERVER['HTTPS'])) {
00337                 return false;
00338         }
00339         
00340         $f = CONTENT_DIR.'/cache/'.$category.'/'.$name;
00341         if (!is_file($f)) {
00342                 return false;
00343         }
00344         // check the file's age
00345         if (version_compare(PHP_VERSION, '5.3.0', '>=')) {
00346                 clearstatcache(true, realpath($f));
00347         } else {
00348                 clearstatcache();
00349         }
00350         $age = filemtime($f);
00351         if ($max_age < abs(time()-$age)) {
00352                 return false;
00353         } else {
00354                 return true;
00355         }
00356 }

00455 /**
00456  *      resolve common aliases which should be used in lieu of explicit page names
00457  *
00458  *      @param string $s input string
00459  *      @param string $name current object name (when applicable)
00460  *      @return string resolved string
00461  */
00462 function resolve_aliases($s, $name = '')
00463 {
00464         // base url
00465         $s = str_replace('$BASEURL$', base_url(), $s);
00466         $s = str_replace('$baseurl$', base_url(), $s);
00467         // version number
00468         $s = str_replace('$GLUE$', HOTGLUE_VERSION, $s);
00469         $s = str_replace('$glue$', HOTGLUE_VERSION, $s);
00470         if (!empty($name)) {
00471                 // current object
00472                 $s = str_replace('$OBJ$', $name, $s);
00473                 $s = str_replace('$obj$', $name, $s);
00474                 // current page
00475                 $s = str_replace('$PAGE$', implode('.', array_slice(expl('.', $name), 0, 2)), $s);
00476                 $s = str_replace('$page$', implode('.', array_slice(expl('.', $name), 0, 2)), $s);
00477                 // pagename
00478                 $s = str_replace('$PAGENAME$', array_shift(expl('.', $name)), $s);
00479                 $s = str_replace('$pagename$', array_shift(expl('.', $name)), $s);
00480                 // protocol used
00481                 $s = str_replace('$PROT$', empty($_SERVER['HTTPS']) ? 'http' : 'https', $s);
00482                 $s = str_replace('$prot$', empty($_SERVER['HTTPS']) ? 'http' : 'https', $s);
00483                 // revision
00484                 $s = str_replace('$REV$', array_shift(array_slice(expl('.', $name), 1, 1)), $s);
00485                 $s = str_replace('$rev$', array_shift(array_slice(expl('.', $name), 1, 1)), $s);
00486         }
00487         return $s;
00488 }

00491 /**
00492  *      resolve relative urls in various page content to include the pages base 
00493  *      url
00494  *
00495  *      this function looks for href and src attributes.
00496  *      @param string $s input string
00497  *      @return string resolved string
00498  */
00499 function resolve_relative_urls($s)
00500 {
00501         $attrs = array('href', 'src');
00502         
00503         foreach ($attrs as $attr) {
00504                 $start = 0;
00505                 while (($start = strpos($s, $attr.'="', $start)) !== false) {
00506                         if (($end = strpos($s, '"', $start+strlen($attr)+2)) !== false) {
00507                                 $link = substr($s, $start+strlen($attr)+2, $end-$start-strlen($attr)-2);
00508                                 if (!is_url($link) && substr($link, 0, 1) != '#') {
00509                                         // add base url for relative links that are not directed towards anchors
00510                                         log_msg('debug', 'common: resolving relative url '.quot($link));
00511                                         if (SHORT_URLS) {
00512                                                 $link = base_url().$link;
00513                                         } else {
00514                                                 $link = base_url().'?'.$link;
00515                                         }
00516                                 } else {
00517                                         log_msg('debug', 'common: not resolving url '.quot($link));
00518                                 }
00519                                 $start = $end+1;
00520                         } else {
00521                                 break;
00522                         }
00523                 }
00524         }
00525         return $s;
00526 }

00569 /**
00570  *      move an uploaded file to the shared directory of a page
00571  *
00572  *      this function reuses existing files when possible.
00573  *      @param string $fn filename of newly uploaded file (most likely in /tmp)
00574  *      @param string $page page or pagename
00575  *      @param string $orig_fn the original filename on the client machine (optional)
00576  *      @param bool &$existed set to true if the filename returned did already exist 
00577  *      before
00578  *      @return filename inside the shared directory or false in case of error
00579  */
00580 function upload_file($fn, $page, $orig_fn = '', &$existed = false)
00581 {
00582         // default to the temporary filename
00583         if ($orig_fn == '') {
00584                 $orig_fn = $fn;
00585         }
00586         
00587         $a = expl('.', $page);
00588         if (count($a) < 1 || !is_dir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$a[0])) {
00589                 log_msg('error', 'common: page '.quot($page).' does not exist, cannot move uploaded file');
00590                 // not sure if we ought to remove the file in /tmp here (probably not)
00591                 return false;
00592         }
00593         
00594         // create shared directory if it doesn't exist yet
00595         $d = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$a[0].'/shared';
00596         if (!is_dir($d)) {
00597                 $m = umask(0000);
00598                 if (!@mkdir($d, 0777)) {
00599                         umask($m);
00600                         log_msg('error', 'common: cannot create shared directory '.quot($d).', cannot move uploaded file');
00601                         // not sure if we ought to remove the file in /tmp here (probably not)
00602                         return false;
00603                 }
00604                 umask($m);
00605         }
00606         
00607         // check if file is already in shared directory
00608         if (($f = dir_has_same_file($d, $fn, $orig_fn)) !== false) {
00609                 log_msg('info', 'common: reusing file '.quot($f).' instead of newly uploaded file as they don\'t differ');
00610                 @unlink($fn);
00611                 $existed = true;
00612                 return $f;
00613         } else {
00614                 // at least give it a unique name
00615                 $f = unique_filename($d, basename($orig_fn));
00616                 $m = umask(0111);
00617                 if (!@move_uploaded_file($fn, $d.'/'.$f)) {
00618                         umask($m);
00619                         log_msg('error', 'common: error moving uploaded file to '.quot($d.'/'.$f));
00620                         // not sure if we ought to remove the file in /tmp here (probably not)
00621                         return false;
00622                 } else {
00623                         umask($m);
00624                         log_msg('info', 'common: moved uploaded file to '.quot($d.'/'.$f));
00625                         $existed = false;
00626                         return $f;
00627                 }
00628         }
00629 }

00632 /**
00633  *      check whether the string is a valid, canonical page name
00634  *
00635  *      the function does not check if the page exists or not.
00636  *      @param string $s string to check
00637  *      @return bool
00638  */
00639 function valid_pagename($s)
00640 {
00641         $a = expl('.', $s);
00642         if (count($a) != 2) {
00643                 return false;
00644         } elseif (empty($a[0]) || empty($a[1])) {
00645                 return false;
00646         } elseif (in_array($a[0], array('cache', 'shared'))) {
00647                 // reserved page names
00648                 // TODO (later): we're missing the log file here
00649                 // TODO (later): we're also missing $arg0 of controllers here
00650                 // TODO (later): we're missing all the files directly in the 
00651                 // content directory here (this might not be an issue on all 
00652                 // os)
00653                 return false;
00654         } elseif (in_array($a[1], array('shared'))) {
00655                 // reserved revision names
00656                 return false;
00657         } elseif (is_file($a[0]) || is_dir($a[0]) || is_link($a[0])) {
00658                 // same name as existing file names in the root directory
00659                 // this is an issue when using the RewriteRule
00660                 return false;
00661         } else {
00662                 return true;
00663         }
00664 }
